hive_text_custom.text: So, Julia, now you are a parent.
And have you heard of all these terms that we have in the US for different types of parents? I wonder if you have them in the UK?
You mean like soccer mum, stuff like that?
That's the only one I've heard of actually.
OK. So what do you think a soccer mom is? What have you heard?
My image is a mother who dedicates her time to running her kids to and from soccer practice. Is that right?
And also drives a big vehicle? My image is of a big SUV or a big four wheel drive.
Right. I think it's also, it's like a parent that has many scheduled events for their child.
So maybe they have swimming class or soccer practice, ballet and stuff like that.
Oh, maybe I'm a little bit of a soccer mum.
Yeah, I think now, yeah. I think it's actually a good term. It's like, I think a soccer mom usually is considered a caring parent.
And they try to have their child doing
It must be pretty, quite an
perhaps middle class kind of parent.
Yeah, exactly, exactly. Now we have the
Is Nascar some kind of car racing?

Yeah, basically it's just the, these cars they run around and ride around in a circle. It's kind of like horse racing for cars, you just go round and round. But, yeah, so I guess it's the same thing. It's just a dad who's really, you know, really into his kids, spends a lot of time with his kids.
Would this be a stay at home dad, like a...?
No, no. It's just kind of like a
father, like a dad who's kind of
, not rich, you know, maybe lower middle class maybe but just kind of like your typical sitcom,
But that's nice. Takes his kids everywhere, that's nice.
Yeah, like a Nascar dad would probably take his sons hunting and maybe take his daughter shopping and stuff like that.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 5) A Nascar dad would take his kids ____.

hive_text_custom.text: Soccer moms try to have their children doing productive            things.
Here, 'productive' activities refer to things that            children can do that teach them and help with development.            Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
You need to try to be more productive during your time              at work.
 I had a very productive day today.

hive_text_custom.text: A soccer mom is an affluent, middle class type of person.
In this case, 'affluent' means a person who has a lot of            money. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
He grew up in a very affluent family.
 This is a very affluent area, so we don't have to worry              much about crime.

hive_text_custom.text: Now we have the equivalent to a soccer mom, which is a            NASCAR dad.
When one thing is 'equivalent' to another, they are            basically equal. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
We are looking for someone to do about 300 hours of              work, which is equivalent to almost 2 months of full-time              work.
 13 Mexican pesos is equivalent to 1 U.S. dollar.

hive_text_custom.text: The phrase 'good-old-boy' is used to refer to a man who is            humble and generally well thought of in his area. Notice the            following:

hive_vocab.examples:
My grandfather is kind of a good-old-boy around here.
 He's a good-old-boy father who teaches his kids to fish              and play baseball.

hive_text_custom.text: A 'blue-collar' worker is someone who works in a factory            job or one that requires a lot of physical labor and not            much formal education. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Most of his family works in blue-collar jobs.
 Almost all of the available jobs in this area are              blue-collar.

hive_text_custom.text: He's kind of like your typical TV sitcom dad, I guess.

A 'sitcom' is a type of television show that uses real            life situations to create comedy. A 'TV sitcom dad' would            act or look the same as a stereotypical dad on television.            Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Some of the TV sitcom dads are really dumb.
 Her dad is basically like a TV sitcom dad.
